messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Hi, I'm new!
messages.msgSnippet: Maybe you could tell us a little more about specifics. Writing them out sometimes helps clarify exactly what the problem is for you. Then you can get a range
messages.messageBody:
Maybe you could tell us a little more about specifics. Writing them
out sometimes helps clarify exactly what the problem is for you. Then
you can get a range of creative ideas to help expand your own out of
the box thinking.

Keep in mind any "behaviors" you find challenging, he is likely
feeling even more challenged. It's hard to be small and have bug
emotions that are difficult to express.

Faith


Sent from my iPhone

On Jul 4, 2009, at 9:27 AM, "kazglc" <kazzarat@...> wrote:

>
>
> I've been on the list a while just taking it all in thought it was
> about time i said hi...i've got 2 boys, aged 4 and 1 year old. I am
> not new to radical unschooling ideas but have been trying to
> implement them more fully in the last 4 mths. I've attachment
> parented from the begininng and radial unschooling seems a natural
> progeression. I find i 'get it' but i'm still struggling with things
> so obviously on some level i'm not 'getting it'!!! I dont have any
> probs with the usual tv, food, bedtime issues - its more how to
> handle the intense personality of my oldest and how to handle/see
> his difficult behaviours.
>
> Anyway - thats just a little intro to say hi!
>
> Kaz x
>
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Hi, I'm new!
messages.msgSnippet: I ve been on the list a while just taking it all in thought it was about time i said hi...i ve got 2 boys, aged 4 and 1 year old.  I am not new to radical
messages.messageBody:
I've been on the list a while just taking it all in thought it was about time i said hi...i've got 2 boys, aged 4 and 1 year old. I am not new to radical unschooling ideas but have been trying to implement them more fully in the last 4 mths. I've attachment parented from the begininng and radial unschooling seems a natural progeression. I find i 'get it' but i'm still struggling with things so obviously on some level i'm not 'getting it'!!! I dont have any probs with the usual tv, food, bedtime issues - its more how to handle the intense personality of my oldest and how to handle/see his difficult behaviours.

Anyway - thats just a little intro to say hi!

Kaz x
